name: Typing series #3 --> copy and paste
description: You are given a ```string``` of lowercase letters and spaces that you need to type out. You may notice some square brackets inside the string. - If it contains letters, type out the text inside then copy it. - If it is empty, paste the copied text - If it contains a number, paste the copied text that number of times. Here are a few examples. `[ten ]ten [3]` -> `ten ten ten ten ten ` `[one hundred and ]one, []two, []three` -> `one hundred and one, one hundred and two, one hundred and three` `[100][repeat me][2]` -> `repeat merepeat merepeat me` (pasting nothing 100 times is still nothing) Notes: - Although it is possible, nested loops will not be tested. - The number inside the bracket will always be a positive integer (1, 2, 3...). - All inputs will be valid (no unclosed brackets, etc) More examples in the smaple tests. Good luck! ______ Check out the rest of the kata in this series!
